Thanks for choosing Opera Touch! This release includes new features, bug fixes and stability improvements.

* Introducing Find in page.
* Show bubbles when editing page address. 
* “Search” option added to context menu on web pages.
* New search engine – Qwant.

Thanks for choosing Opera Touch! This release introduces private mode, voice search and better iPad support. In the menu, you’ll find the function to translate web pages. Last but not least, there are bug fixes, visual changes to make Opera Touch look better, and stability fixes.

Thanks for choosing Opera Touch! In this release we introduce built-in crypto wallet. Now Opera touch supports Ethereum, a popular and quickly growing protocol that allows people to make transactions and developers to create decentralized apps, which provide practical use for this technology.

Thanks for choosing Opera Touch! This update will help you find pages in your history much faster with a new search bar. Now with my Flow you can share and store images, videos and notes across devices. This feature ensures a smooth connection between your phone and computer.

Opera Touch now let you choose the most convenient navigation to explore the web, making it the best mobile browser for iOS. When you use the app for the first time, you will customize it and choose between standard bottom navigation and the Fast Action Button. However, you can always change this at anytime in your settings. In this version there are also multiple bug fixes that improve stability and security.

Thanks for choosing Opera Browser! 

NEW: Speed Dial

Previously, the start page included multiple sections: Top sites from the browsing history, Starred sites, Crypto Wallet explorer and Recent tabs from Desktop if connected via Flow.

The start page is now simplified to include only one main section: the Speed Dial. You can add and arrange items the way you like. New sites will appear at the end of the list. The top six sites from previous versions will be moved to the speed dial section after the upgrade. Although the order of items may change a bit after upgrade, you can now change it the way you want.

*Recent tabs will still be shown as a separate section below the Speed Dial.

Thanks for choosing Opera Browser!

NEW: Speed Dial

Previously, the start page included multiple sections: Top sites from the browsing history, Starred sites, Crypto Wallet explorer and Recent tabs from Desktop if connected with Flow.

The start page is now simplified, uses less space and includes only one main section: the Speed Dial. You can add and arrange items the way you like. New sites will appear at the end of the list. If you upgrade from a previous build, the top sites and starred items will be moved to the Speed Dial section in the same order as they were listed before.

*Recent tabs will still be shown as a separate section below the Speed Dial.

Thanks for choosing Opera Browser! This version includes latest bug fixes and improvements.

- Fixes an issue with scroll position when navigating back. In certain scenarios the page would always reset position to the top. This would be particularly annoying when reading news in a long list of articles and having to start from the top of the list after finishing an article.
- While we were at it, we also improved page scroll position restore when restarting the app or switching to another tab.

- We have improved how to organise the Speed Dial on the Home screen. Long press an item and select to "reorder" in the popup menu, then drag and drop items in the order you want. You can also delete items in this mode. Enjoy!
